comments.html: It's likely that those features you mentioned that are in 802.1Qbh but not in the current Fabric Extenders will be available in future Fabric Extender products.
comments.name: PG

comments.html: No doubt Cisco will have something similar and/or fully support 802.1Qbh. I just wanted to point out the differences that exist today.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
one of beautiful limitations currently on the Nexus 2k or 5k is the inability to configure SPAN session that has source and destination on the same 5k FEX interface.

So say you want to span the traffic between one server in the rack, into another server in the same rack - bad luck with your "top of the rack" design, you need to pull another cable from N5k directly into the server.

Also, as a rant, the older generation of N2k had 1000Mbps port only, so connecting servers with iLO/remote management card that is only capable of 100Mbps was not possible, you had had to pull YET ANOTHER cable from N5k....
comments.name: Pavel Skovajsa

comments.html: Not to mention, the 2148s have the "no port-channel" limitation as well.
comments.name: triegert

comments.html: features you mentioned that are in 802.1Qbh but not in the current Fabric Extenders will be available in future Fabric Extender products.

comments.html: Fabric Extender Tranceiver(FET) have limitations with the 5k FEX interface too.
